review: quince great yet again we are currently doing our swan song regarding our favorite restaurant in san francisco for year we were in that city at least once a month and always enjoyed our dining there those business trip are winding down a my wife corporate office have moved to chicago so our trip to san francisco are slowing coming to an end we have set out to dine at our favorite restaurant in that great dining city and quince ha always been at the top of our list a sommelier friend gave me the name quince at pacific ave by chef michael tusk you must dine there i took him at his word and did so shortly after they opened unfortunately my wife had a dinner meeting that evening so i wa solo she wa able to sneak in and have some wine with me a i wa finishing up the tasting menu i knew that i had to return and with her soon i did over the year we have watched them expand the restaurant and gain michelin star along we way we have had many excellent meal there a well a having attended several culinary event such a chef michael anthony of gramercy tavern in nyc each meal each visit ha been extraordinary and then there are the wonderful wine pairing quince quickly became our favorite restaurant in san francisco and one of our favorite around the world this august visit wa no different than all of the rest and i wa able to dine with my wife for the entire meal which is always a big plus for me the restaurant is lovely on the inside with a sense of refined elegance in every aspect the staff wa wonderful a always and so wa the meal the chef tasting menu and a per our usual the sommelier wine pairing the lighting is subdued but one can still easily take in the culinary artistry appearing before them the dish are all a sight to behold but unlike some chef michael tusk doe not resort to cryo or pyro technics but just artistically created plating and food the table are well spaced so service is easy even in the banquette seating area which we had near the front entrance and in the main dining room the noise level is usually quite low and wa on this visit it wa easy to hear the description of each dish and each wine with the table spacing we could barely hear anything else in the room just a lovely evening also the floral arrangement were magnificent their menu change with the season and often with even greater regularity depending on what chef tusk ha available some year ago they created quince farm so have a more constant supply of various item but then there are still the season so the menu will change most of their menu showcase the produce from the farm and then much of the rest is locally sourced so it can depend on what is ready to come to the table we did the full tasting menu an abbreviated version is available in their salon with course and two amuse bouche course plus the sommelier wine beverage pairing do not be surprised if a sake or an ale show up at the table which ran right at diner and wa well worth the price now we did start the evening off with a glass each of krug from the champagne cart so that did run the price up a bit each dish wa a culinary and visual delight and each wine beverage complimented each dish wonderfully pacing wa absolute perfection with no pause and nothing rushed at any time our top did accumulate a lot of wine glass we like to save a sip or two just to see how they go with later dish but we still had ample room for the plate and more wine glass service wa flawless and i really appreciate that the sommelier took the time to talk a bit about each wine and why it wa chosen to pair with each dish the stemware wa all zalto or riedel and every stem wa varietally appropriate to the wine beverage inside lovely to behold hold and sip from a highlight of this visit wa a tour of the kitchen probably the one place where we had never been at quince and an introduction to chef tusk we got to sit at a little table there with our wine and watch the staff in action plus the sommelier remembered that we both loved the philippe colin montrachet and had two glass of that waiting in the kitchen he then had two black wine glass at our table in the dining room and we had to guess the wine thing such a that really add to the overall dining experience a beautiful evening with my beautiful wine in a very refined and elegant setting with fantastic food just another perfect evening quince is one restaurant that we would fly to san francisco just to dine there and we have done that for a couple of their special dinner already were also scheduled to attend a culinary event with chef tusk at a little place in the smoky mountain next summer more

review: it took me year to try this place because the wait is always long now that i ve eaten here i understand why people wait so long first it is teeny tiny thank goodness they ve been able to add parklets to increase capacity slightly when you arrive and i recommend you do so early you put your name on the list and then you wait often more than minute i suggest you cross the street to swirl buy a bottle of wine and enjoy it at swirl while you wait anchor also offer a corkage fee so you can bring in any bottle of your choice we started with crab cake and oyster i tend to avoid crab cake outside of the eastern seaboard but these were sublime lightly crispy on the outside and full of real crab on the inside the oyster were fantastic i tried one of several type most of the food is served in large plate so it is shareable a wa the caesar salad one serving wa more than enough for the three of u we ordered the large cioppino and it wa huge in retrospect the small which is also huge would have probably served all three of u a we ended up taking some of the cioppino home the cioppino might be the best i ve had in san francisco which is saying something since san francisco is the birthplace of cioppino and many restaurant brag about theirs to accompany the cioppino i highly recommend the garlic bread which perfectly soak up the tomato base this wa a birthday dinner and it couldn t have been a better meal more

review: nopa wa outstanding and our most memorable meal during our recent west coast visit celebrated my birthday here and from the moment we arrived and to the very end had a fabulous time we had made dinner reservation a few week beforehand when we arrived we were seated upstairs overlooking the kitchen the perfect location we were in awe and loved the view every dish looked salivatingly fabulous love the little touch and attention to detail the seamless teamwork of staff coordinated effort delicious wonderful experience how the various staff wished me a happy birthday most other place i ve been to don t even acknowledge this wa appreciated how when they thought we were waiting too long for our main course they brought up complimentary appetizer though we didn t notice a we were thoroughly mesmerized and entertained by the kitchen view inventive twist on simple locally sourced foodsall truly appreciated the food oh so fabulous and flavorful the dish we head were delicious and of sizeable portion they also offer a delicious non alcoholic drink made with grapefruit juice cardamom bitter and tonic perfect for someone like me for appetizer we had fried brussels sprout this wa the complimentary dish surprised by and love the pickled quince scrumptious wood baked butter bean we noticed that on the west coast butter bean seem to be quite the popular item so we decided to give it a try happy we did damn delicious smoked trout absolutely our fave love the beet hummus blood orange and roe terrific burst of flavor main course braised duck leg i love duck this wa quite good housemade pappardelle with hour bolognese yummy at this point we were quite stuffed but there s always room for dessert dessert poppyseed donut we really enjoyed this the donut were not review: this wa an exquisite experience led by our server timothy this guy wa a veteran and it showed the hostess warmly greeted u and got u seated earlier than our reservation time we were immediately impressed by the interior design and the perfect amount of lighting that created a romantic ambiance the room temperature wa also spot on many place miss this part we loved the pre fix style dining automatically choosing an app entree and dessert for one price it set the tone for the pace of the experience and added an element of simplicity that we enjoyed of course my wife and i selected different item from the menu so we could share we enjoyed the ahi tuna tar tar seared sea scallop both appetizer were full of flavor and the scallop were seared to a perfect medium temperature the way the ahi tuna wa plated allowed for different flavor profile with each bite the main course delivered quality and excellence my wife selected the halibut and i decided on the filet nice little surf turf the hef nailed the cooking of halibut a no one like an overcooked filet of fish the sauce added savory note that paired excellently with my wife s soft red wine she chose i enjoyed the filet grilled perfectly medium rare topped with various type of mushroom all the mushroom were not only different flavor but also different texture detail like this make you want to slow down and enjoy every bite with real intention our final course wa dessert where my wife went with the option of the cheese tray i loved that they had that option a my wife doesn t consume white flour or sugar except for special occasion i settled in with the brown butter pear tart and it wa ridiculous the chewy texture of the tart and the creaminess of the brown butter left me feeling let down when i finished because i wanted more overall timothy navigated u the entire way i spent year in the restaurant industry and am consistently disappointed when dining out this wa a home run i ve been gluten free for year and he perfectly managed my dietary need it s always nice when you get to connect with people when you re traveling so thank you everyone at boulevard for creating a meaningful memory for my wife and me cheer to your continued success more

many more those are winding down a her corporate office are moving to chicago so we have been doing our swan song of san francisco dining making sure to get back to our favorite while we still can boulevard at mission st not too far from the ferry plaza building and the bay ha been one of our favorite over the year since we first discovered it well we did not actually discover it per se a one of my wife san francisco co worker first recommended it and we sort of filed the name away for later then a year later a friend who is a sommelier in san francisco said you must visit boulevard for their wine but do stay for the food two recs and we booked boulevard for the next trip we did go for the wine and stayed for chef nancy oakes food that wa probably about visit ago scattered several month apart this visit wa just under month since we had last dined there often i have to meet my wife for dinner a her meeting always seem to run over this visit to boulevard wa an exception and i think that it wa the first time that we walked through the door together at least in many year we were seated at a small table along the window looking out onto mission st with a view of the open kitchen to my left and to much of the main dining room over the year we have ordered la carte but also enjoyed chef oakes seasonal tasting menu which is what we decided on this visit while maybe not truly farm to table chef oakes mostly doe local sourcing such a the monterey bay octopus on the tasting menu the wine that were part of that initial recommendation were still on the list in some instance we have turned the sommelier loose to pair the wine but a boulevard ha a very good half bottle list that wa the direction i went with a we often dine a a couple a workable list of half bottle will allow me to do my own pairing without sacrificing to a b t g list though boulevard is a good one or having to pair just the perfect bottle with all dish and especially a tasting menu all of the very nice the only little complaint that i had wa that this table wa small but almost all along the exterior wall are i like the two booth across the aisle from where we sat but then one back is to the open kitchen this table would have been problematic if we had gone with the sommelier wine pairing but with just glass each we managed fine the lighting is good and we had the benefit of the early evening sky through the window the noise level rose to about moderate and especially when the little bar toward the front of the restaurant filled up still easy conversation wa possible there is seating at the front of the restaurant but i find that with it proximity to the bar it can get a bit loud plus patron entering the restaurant walk right beside your table i prefer the area to the rear closest to the kitchen a it is usually quieter and ha far far le foot traffic i am not sure if well make it back but hope to at least once more before all of our trip point toward chicago instead of review: we traveled to san francisco for my wife birthday and wanted a nice restaurant that wa a little off the beaten path for a special dinner several friend that know the city had recommended milano and we were certainly not disappointed first off the service wa perfect not obtrusive but properly attentive we were greeted very warmly by the hostess more on that later and our server helped with excellent suggestion all the way around one of our issue im going to a nice italian restaurant is a finicky teenager who generally wont eat anything more interesting than pasta with olive oil and parmesan our server had the kitchen make a fettuccine dish that wa within her strike zone but a little more adventurous than the crap she normally eats my wife had gnocchi in a tomato and basil sauce and i had veal marsala with a side of pasta in a sausage cream sauce all of it wa tremendous the thing that stood out the most wa your fresh everything tasted for u that is what separate milano from so many other italian restaurant that we have visited the bruschetta wa a definite standout and the wine list ha some gem the pacing of the dinner wa perfect nobody hurried u if we needed anything there wa somebody right there and it wa all very pleasant and relaxing we took our time lingering the way you probably would over dinner in italy and everybody even finicky daughter agree that it is one of the best meal we have ever had in our travel but what really made the visit memorable is the way that the staff observed what wa for u a very special occasion it wa not only my wife birthday but also the fifth anniversary of her being confirmed cancer free i mentioned that we were celebrating both item when i made the reservation the hostess having been through similar struggle herself could not have been sweeter to my wife a they shared a really good genuine heartfelt bonding moment more

review: this bar is an awesome hidden prohibition era speak easy esque bar it s quite hard to find look out for the anti saloon league advertising board and then the non descript wooden door underneath entry is strictly via booking only and you need to give it name and the secret code word inside it s a very dark bar with a no mobile or photography policy which is refreshingly very nice the drink menu is great they serve some lovely cocktail and very thorough extensive list of bourbon and single malt they play music fitting with what i would imagine the prohibition era would play and staff are dressed in peaky blinder style clothing when you have had a few nice drink in here pop next door to their sister bar the library which is more casual and no booking required both were very nice experience i would visit here again and recommend it to friend and familymore

review: i went to belotti for dinner with a couple of friend this wa my first time there we were seated outside on the wide sidewalk around the corner from the main entrance on college avenue there are a number of table there we started with a small antipasto plate and it wa larger than we expected full of terrific item including prosciutto salame toscano salamino calabrese three excellent cheese olive sliced pear and apple nut and a generous portion of crostini the americana salad wa large and delicious with arugula beet squash goat cheese toasted hazelnut and a tasty dressing that wasn t too sweet or overpowering for entree one of my friend had the spaghetti pomodoro e burrata and my other friend had the casoncelli bergamaschi stuffed pasta with beef prosciutto pork shoulder grana padano smoked pancetta butter and sage both looked great particularly the casoncelli i had the agnolotti di lidia a piemontese style stuffed pasta with beef shank flat iron sausage escarole spinach and gran padano with a beef reduction sauce absolutely amazing dish everything went together perfectly the portion for the main dish were ideal for u not overly large but by no mean skimpy really just right i skipped desert but my friend had tiramisu and affogato al caffe big portion on those belotti ha a large and very well priced wine list nearly all selection from italy we shared a bottle of francone grignolino from piemonte grignolino is a variety i enjoy a lot and this bottle wa excellent service wa efficient but friendly low key and not obtrusive at all our server wa helpful with a few question we had about the menu choice and wine list and the price of the meal for the quality wa unbeatable i ve been hearing great thing about belotti for awhile and my first visit there lived up to my expectation and then some best dinner i ve had this year just outstanding and i ll be sure to come back more

review: some time ago we were introduced to their takeout location further south in oakland on piedmont by our good friend you can check out our review by following u on tripadvisor having such a great introduction we then found out about their main restaurant we went there for a late lunch but their menu seems to be the same regardless much like many others who ve dined and reviewed this place our meal wa fantastic we made our reservation online and did arrive early and tried to get seated understandably they were jam packed inside and out that wa ok because it gave u some extra time to explore the nearby shop store it s located in the rockridge area of oakland and actually there s lot to enjoy and explore that s for another review though we returned to the restaurant at pm and got our table outside along the sidewalk at first we were a little unsure about it because their website seemed to show they had a larger patio dining area or so we thought regardless it turned out fine it wa obvious that they had a server staffing shortage based on our observation it took some time to get our server s attention and he wa a little frazzled once we had his attention or he had ours thing went well it wa easy to overlook the several slight misstep he made up for it with his entertaining quirky style a for the cuisine it wa to die for my wife ordered their lattuga butter lettuce w toasted pine nut and lemon dressing a her main dish along with side of fagiolini green bean and brussel sprout all of that wa amazing and with ample portion i ordered their gnocchi alla bolognese potato gnocchi w six meat sauce again it wa just perfect for beverage my wife had the pellegrino water and i ordered a glass of the brunello di montalcini while that glass alone wa the most expensive item on the menu it wa delicious and worth the price along speaking of price all this great lunch experience wa le than wow i gave it a cheap eats selection but it really is great food at a great price if you love classic italian cuisine at a great price this is the place to go we would return in a second more

review: we keep coming back to this well known eatery this wa our third time in probably three year excluding for obvious reason still in the late pandemic period we chose here again this time we dined outside on the sidewalk even though they had just opened up inside for limited seating we were apprehensive at first due to the uncertain sf weather and the unpredictable pedestrian vehicle traffic noise we re pleased to say our worse fear were not experienced maybe a little cold but they do provide very nice heater this time we chose to order the florentine tomato soup fantastic taste and market salad w mixed seasonal veggie and lettuce a starter the white balsamic vinaigrette dressing on the salad wa perfect my soup had to be one of the best warm tomato soup ever too bad it s seasonal my wife also ordered a glass of peter paul chardonnay one of the best chard one can enjoy for our main course we ordered the short rib w sweet corn polenta halibut w braised potato along with side of snap pea salad and pan roasted cauliflower again the short rib were wonderfully moist and the halibut wa one of the best for dessert we ordered the panna cotta to go by this time it wa a bit too chilly and windy we left very pleased with our first venture out in you can rest assured that dining here is safe inside or out depending on your personal level of comfort the food continues to be superb our server benjamin wa also outstanding more

review: their website say that the opening of green in ha forever changed the image and appreciation of vegetarian food in america recommended highly by the cognoscenti green quite life up to it reputation the location brings it great value nestled in fort mason which is replete with history with view of the bay and the golden gate bridge tastefully done muted interior and the neatly laid out table outdoor with space heater that blunt the sharp wind blowing off the bay it a big thumb up for the ambience for the entree we ordered a small plate of grilled peach with goat cheese watercress salad honey and hazelnut the peach were grilled just enough without taking away the softness and aroma of the fruit the goat cheese took a little getting used to but the watercress salad honey and roasted hazelnut brought it all together to a nicety the soup of the day chickpea in tomato wa pure comfort food nothing new nothing distinctive the roasted heirloom tomato pizza with farm herb and mozzarella wa very good the crust and cheese done to perfection and the herb and tomato both subtle yet rich with authenticity chipotle barbecued eggplant with summer bean corn tomato roasted poblanos and jalapeno cornbread wa a bit underwhelming the eggplant wa a tad too dominant jalapeo cornbread did not really fit in and the roasted poblanos could have had a stronger presence yet there wa not a single jarring element the portion are deceptive and we had no space left for dessert this wa a happy thing because we were already looking forward to coming back with such a formidable reputation a premium location and an uncommon cuisine green could have been much heavier on the purse if at all one ha to pick a bone it would be that there could have been more on the menu exclusively vegetarian restaurant are hard to come by and a few more option would have been welcome more

review: we were finally able to try lolinda it wa not really worth the wait not spanish lolinda bill itself a able to transport a patron from the street of the mission to a one of a kind argentinian experience it is here where according to it website that lolinda s chef strives to create a curated menu that combine latin american flavor with california sensibility the dark place is not intimate it is crowded with small table pushed close together conversation with the person across from me wa difficult at best a loud see and be seen place that seems all too typical in san francisco now this is what unwashed diner in the city want i guess food wa good if a bit over priced given the size of the portion wine were decent pours by the glass and at reasonable price suggest trying the sparkling malbec ro dry hint of the grape skin nice finish in trying to find a real argentine style empanada gonna have to keep looking while the mostly vegetarian filling in the hongo wa excellent the pastry dough wa almost too sweet and buttery like an apple or cherry turnover sweet or savory here you can have both at once in every bite pa you know i love octopus and so we ordered the pulpo small dish some piece too salty and overcooked while others were almost raw the broccolini wa cooked perfectly still dark green and firm the champinones mushroom were one of the highlight served in the style of many buenos aire eatery with the hot mushroom on the bottom and a cold bed of arugula on top with the seco de carne beef short rib wa a polenta i wish i could make this wa probably the highlight creamy but not too creamy with garlic and a wine reduction drizzle service wa awful our waiter initially talked up the argentina angle but then pushed peruvian ceviche on u we passed yeah it s a latin or south american dish one can also find in place that feature cuisine from ecuador chile colombia and even mexico but it ain t typically argentine the staff wa in a hurry a it wa getting close to closing time but our guy tried to leave without taking our order when he did deign to take our order we waited interminably and then thing were just dumped on the table and a soon a a dish appeared done zip zip zip the plate wa magically gone from our table we must have had six or seven staff at our table but we had to cancel one item that never arrived delay delay delay and then pow pow pow pop not worth the wait the cost or the trouble parking in the mission at night i can think of better place to take my hunger and chubby face however if you only come alive when dining with of your new best friend talking app shop glued to phone with sketchy service and eating about half of every portion brought to their table then this is your spot make one wonder though it s the old chicken versus egg debate do place like lolinda morph into eatery where patron still stinking of sweat and gym drizzle feel literally at home in their funk and on their phone or did lolinda and it ilk engender the century diner sans souci the world may never know workingman s gourmandmore

offered u a glass of wine a we waited made suggestion kept u apprised of table status it s a small downstairs location one long communal table down the center surrounded by old fashioned cubby quasi booth really table and chair separated by wall nice old time vibe it loud friendly lotsa pizza order hostess bus waitperson who brought dessert all very friendly smiling our main waitperson appeared to be the only staffer we saw who never smiled no suggestion no helpful comment we d ask is x good she d say yes i finally asked are you going to just say everything s good and got a tight grin a a response chianti recommended by hostess wa good menu is very minimal name of dish minimal or no description of ingredient or preparation they put some very hot bread on the table nice that it wa very fresh but it a mushy soft tasteless white bread reminiscent of something you can buy frozen at the grocery store and bake yourself had to ask for a refill and refill came partially warm partially chilled they re definitely baking from pre made whether pre made in house or purchased can t tell i started with carpaccio generous portion but nothing noteworthy no offer of bread others ordered baked fresh clam no description on menu other than a specialty traditional italian baked clam are topped with bread crumb herb laid out etc this wa a bowl of clam in a broth much more like italian steamed clam tasty broth but unremarkable a the reason for choosing tommaso s big disappointment i ordered eggplant parmesan again no description on menu traditional eggplant parm is sliced eggplant dipped in egg batter fried then laid out in a casserole with sauce and cheese this wa just sliced eggplant a relatively tasteless marinara and cheese result mushy eggplant not bad but not much better than a frozen entree a side of lukewarm penne topped with about tb of the same marinara wa plopped down beside it i didn t know it wa coming or might have asked for an option rather than exact same sauce a eggplant others pasta side served at the table had much more sauce and were hotter a a result the seafood pasta ordered by another wa much better two said their rolletini wa good but good wa the best anyone could say nothing excellent no wow overall there s a family style vibe but it border on conveying that no one care about presentation food s just dumped in bowl and pushed out of the kitchen tiramisu served in small soup cup wa mediocre and lacking in either espresso or liqueur flavor i had cannoli i asked if fresh filled etc friendly support waitress assured me it wa cannoli wa very good cannoli and chianti were only thing that weren t disappointment family visiting from out of town referred to experience a their only miss or disappointment of their trip to foody san francisco i might go in there to try a pizza every pizza we saw go by looked excellent but i wouldn t go back for entree dinner more

review: i would love to write a better review but unfortunately the wait wa abysmal and we had to leave before our food wa served we had ticket to hear michelle obama at pm and were excited to make reservation at le colonial reservation were for and unfortunately due to traffic we arrived at pm after calling to let them know and being told no problem i had asked for outdoor dining covid and were initially seated in the upstairs glass covered greenhouse type area with overhead heater perfect for dining and feeling slightly safer than indoors we were seated at a table where the overhead heater wasn t working and were quickly moved to an adjacent table when we requested it we were fairly quickly asked about water choice of tap v carbonated that wa the end of our service we waited for before flagging a waiter to order drink and because they were so busy and obviously short staffed we placed our entire order at that time after another wait our appetizer imperial crab roll quite delicious still no cocktail but we were assured the drink would eventually arrive which they eventually did and i enjoyed the tamarind margarita and hubby a glass of wine then more and more wait because we needed to get to the masonic auditorium when no meal had shown up hr and minute after we had first arrived i spoke with the hostess i indicated that we needed to leave and wanted to pay profuse apology from the hostess who shared that the kitchen wa quite busy the check eventually arrived and we paid with a generous tip for the wait staff who clearly were doing the best they could the hostess indicated that the chef profusely apologized when i asked if we might have a complementary meal in the future i wa assured that the chef would contact me while it s possible i missed a return call there were no voice message a noted i wa very much looking forward to the evening and the meal two hour should have been plenty of time for a meal i would strongly suggest that le colonial not accept any more reservation than can be handled by the existing staff wait staff and kitchen i m ambivalent about eating there again more

review: we are regular but infrequent visitor to san francisco every year but for the past year or so we have always visited slanted door at least twice per visit and been knocked out with the food setting and service in fact two year ago on a u wide tour of fine eatery it wa the best meal we found so it wa with great anticipation that we returned last night to introduce colleague to the delight regretfully thing seem to have changed a few recent review hinted that it had started to rest on it laurel but we were unprepared for the degree of decline we were shown to our table by a very dour and graceless hostess and then greeted by a server who hopped from foot to foot like a toddler wanting the toilet whilst wearing a smirk right out of the priti patel collection the appetiser were a we remembered fresh and very tasty although the second order of dumpling were a bit heavy on garlic the wine wa also great and fairly priced gruner veltliner with our appetiser and pinot noir with our main the main course were appalling a whole black bass wa charred and massively overcooked priti reacted badly to having his attention drawn to it and declared that a repeat order would be cooked just the same so my colleague ordered scallop a did i they were literally thrown in the table in front of him by a different server without a word the scallop were large and well cooked but the accompanying sauce wa incredibly acidic and unpleasant to the taste i left most of mine priti had by this time vacated the premise perhaps to give the many unfortunate homeless people in sf a good kicking a pleasant young lady enquired about our meal and expressed her apology after we had regaled her with our experience she deducted the appetiser and one main from the bill this wa a welcome and proportionate response but could obviously not fully make up for the huge disappointment it will be interesting to see whether the slanted door will still be in business the next time we visit in more

review: i had dinner with friend at tadich grill my first time there it s really a san francisco institution the oldest restaurant in the city and a definite old school throwback in term of the atmosphere and menu it s very close to several public transit option so that s what i took to get there my friend and i were seated at one of the semi enclosed table behind the large central bar our server wa great and very attentive even though it wa a busy evening at the restaurant and other staff were helpful a well although there are other item on the menu tadich grill s specialty is seafood and i ordered the mesquite charcoal broiled petrale sole filet served with long branch potato plus broccoli cauliflower and carrot the portion wa larger than i d expected and the fist wa prepared very simply and wa delicious the potato were also good but the vegetable although cooked just enough were lukewarm at best perhaps an issue with the busy night but still not what you d hope for there wa a limited choice of wine by the glass on the main menu i didn t ask whether there wa a separate wine list but the wine i ordered wa fine and went well with the sole tadich is a bit pricey which wa not unexpected but seems like a good choice for a special night out particularly if you re looking for a more traditional san francisco meal not a place i d return to often but i d be happy to go back more

review: once upon a time in the city of san francisco a place renowned for it culinary diversity and vibrant dining scene i embarked on an evening at the esteemed tadich grill brimming with anticipation my party and i sauntered into the restaurant eagerly awaiting a culinary experience that had been lauded for it historical significance and gastronomic delight a we settled into our seat the initial charm of the restaurant enveloped u the vintage decor aged wood and murmur of lively conversation whisked u away to a time when hospitality wa an art form practiced with reverence and dedication but ala dear reader our fleeting sense of enchantment wa soon shattered like a fragile champagne flute dropped on the cold unforgiving kitchen floor upon perusing the menu we discovered that not everyone in our group wa inclined to indulge in a full fledged dinner some among u perhaps le ravenous or with dietary restriction sought only to sample the appetizer and drink that tadich grill had to offer a simple request we thought for any dining establishment that prided itself on being a beacon of hospitality yet a the evening unfurled it became glaringly evident that the power that be at tadich grill had forgotten the very essence of hospitality choosing instead to wield their authority with a heavy hand and an iron will like a sommelier refusing to pour a glass of wine for a parched soul the manager emerged from the shadow casting his disapproving gaze upon u with a tone a frigid a the fog rolling in from the bay he unceremoniously declared that we were not welcome to occupy our table unless all member of our party partook in the sacred ritual of ordering a full meal the callousness of the proclamation left u stunned our sense of disbelief matched only by the audacity of the decree itself in that moment i yearned for the day of old when the sanctity of the dining table reigned supreme and the customer wa revered a royalty a time when a matre d would have charmed u with his suave demeanor seating u with a flourish and a smile regardless of our culinary inclination a time when the staff s aim wa not merely to fill table but to fill heart with joy and delight i pondered how tadich grill a bastion of tradition had strayed so far from the true essence of hospitality a restaurant that had witnessed generation of diner breaking bread and forging memory now chose to cast aside potential patron merely because their desire did not align with a rigid outdated model good service my dear reader transcends the perfunctory act of placing plate before patron and whisking them away when empty it resides in the warmth of a welcoming smile the attentiveness to individual need and the genuine desire to make every guest feel special regardless of their appetite ala tadich grill s misguided stance left a bitter taste in my mouth not from the fare they served but from the disheartening realization that they had lost sight of what it truly meant to treat customer with the respect and consideration they deserved a i departed from that storied establishment i couldn t help but wonder if the ghost of bygone culinary legend wept at the state of hospitality in the present day may this lament serve a a reminder to all who enter the realm of gastronomy it is not just the food that leaf a lasting impression but the graciousness and hospitality bestowed upon every soul that cross the threshold more

review: food this is arguably the best culinary adventure of my life so far and loved that it s served family style for everyone to share we ordered the following dish below all were extremely fresh and tasty but the burrata scarlet runner bean were my absolute favorite the perfect combination of texture crispy bean and melt in your mouth burrata with the marvelous layering of flavor earthy bean creamy cheese topped with zesty pomelo caviar potato cloud almost like a potato flavored bubble around salty briny sea bubble riverdog farm pig head fennel shinko pear chile fish sauce tender almost paper thin sliced salty contrasted with pear burrata scarlet runner bean pomelo avocado lemongrass guava see above zuckerman farm asparagus carmelized onion marcona almond tender asparagus with delectable savory onion paired with crispy almond coal roasted pea crispy galangal tofu rhubarb cashew rau ram lime local halibut crudo cherry aguachile fava bean basil grilled alaskan halibut artichoke barigoule alubla blanca bean green garlic perfectly cooked halibut fried whole mcfarland spring trout blue corn mandarin tomatillo salsa macha black rice batter perfectly protected the trout allowing it to be cooked to perfectionservice wa almost impeccable the only downside wa our party had asked for hot water and lemon which the server agreed brought the hot water but forgot the lemon we reminded her again but by the end of service she still didn t bring the lemon not a big deal especially given we arrived towards the end of service but nevertheless wa a slight hiccup in our otherwise flawless service experience ambience the progress offer an elevated but not stuffy dining experience you walk into a small waiting reservation where you re greeted by the maitre d you can see a casual bar area which is usually full the main dining room feature plenty of plant which downplay the two story ceiling making the experience feel incredibly comfortable and not ostentatious at all note there isn t much of a waiting area i d recommend bringing a warm jacket if it s cold outside value the total for our dinner came out to food tax and tip which is person while it is pricy we felt the culinary adventure wa definitely worth the price especially for a special occasion more

review: great cheeseburger at an asian restaurantwe were staying around the corner from e o asian kitchen at sutter st at the edge of san franciscos union square area on our second trip to san francisco in july i had read of it on the tripadvisor san francisco destination forum and it always got great recommendation so i decided to try it for lunch one day and i wa glad that i had done so i arrived just a they were opening for lunch and entered taking in the interior it could have been a restaurant in thailand or many other place in southeast asia malaysia i spotted the bar to the right and rear of the dining room and the little living room waiting area and took a seat the bartender wa just setting up and had the menu to me quickly i looked over the wine b t g list and decided on laurenz v singing grner veltliner from the short but interesting wine list i wa really not in the mood for asian though i wa seated in an asian restaurant and bar a we had done thai and japanese for three dinner already yet i had read so much about e o that i wa determined to eat lunch there i mentioned my dilemma to the bartender and he highly recommended their e o cheeseburger on house made scallion bun with white cheddar kim chi sriracha aioli house made pickle and togarashi fry sounded good so i ordered that along with a glass of trig point diamond dust alexander valley cabernet sauvignon i hesitated over the robert biale black chicken vineyard zinfandel but a i have case of that in my cellar back in phoenix decided on a wine that i had never tasted and the trig point wa one turned out to be a good pairing with the cheeseburger now the cheeseburger is a monster and it had to be cut to be eaten the burger patty wa cooked perfectly and wa tasty and juicy the bun wa also very good a were the cheddar and kim chi sriracha aioli the fry seemed to have been hand cut and not out of a lb sack from the freezer a great burger and i would rank it about or on my continuing burger quest in san francisco this wa a burger worth returning for and in an asian restaurant the restaurant did fill up with lunch time diner and it seemed that the staff knew most of them so i would say many were returning local always a good sign the noise level rose a bit but not too badly given the crowd the lighting over the bar wa more than adequate and i have to give the bartender credit for still checking on me even when the crowd picked up the main dining room wa smallish but looked comfortable with good lighting too i saw a balcony but do not know if there wa additional dining upstairs or if this wa just an architectural element the dcor wa very tasteful and maybe even a tad understated attractive i have another lunch option in san francisco though our trip are winding down now and would not hesitate to order the cheeseburger again even in this asian restaurant more

review: some good friend recommended this charming place on street near church st note the street address carefully it s unclear that is even a restaurant when you look directly at it there is little or no signage my theory is that this intersection may be sf s version of the bermuda triangle a there is something magical here a historic muni trolley car rumble by every so often making the wide turn up church street stand at this broad intersection for a few minute and see if you have the same sensation step inside the door of la ciccia and you will encounter a heavy red drape push the drape aside to find an intimate dining room and small bar the ambience is so romantic i began to wonder how many marriage proposal occurred here hidden away a it wa the restaurant wa completely full on a cold december evening those who have found this place clearly become repeat customer check out the menu on their web site to see their menu everything our party of five ordered wa delicious the waiter wa extremely helpful in making wine recommendation and you will find they have a very extensive selection a couple owns and operates the restaurant and the wife came up to personally see that we were satisfied it wa clear that she knew most of the patron that evening our party being somewhat of an outlier i d strongly recommend reservation for your visit given la ciccia s obviously popularity if you a ready to pop the question to someone special this may be your venue more

review: i am delighted to report that acquerello ha not been part of a trend of rapidly declining service standard that seems to have accelerated and been used a an excuse in the time of covid instead acquerello may be one of the last great dining institution in a city that is known to set a worldwide standard for outstanding food the dining room itself is meticulously maintained and is absolutely lovely beautiful fresh flower arrangement wonderful furnishing well pressed linen beautiful china and well spaced table well spaced table seem to have gone by the wayside a a standard for a first class restaurant fortunately acquerello ha maintained this standard this alone allows for the ability to have a conversation at your table without shouting and is a great feature during covid did i mention they have linen with the leadership of the amazing isabella paterlini the service is absolutely superb friendly warm elegant and unobtrusive the choreography is a pleasure to observe the team that made it happen for our evening wa exceptional kevin lee a general manager wa in the dining room throughout working in tandem with a superb group of people even the busser had an elegance that rivaled a food server in most upscale restaurant davide who presided over our table wa also especially charming and had an exceptional knowledge of the extensive dish that were presented during our meal the sommelier had a lyrical narrative for the wine he wa serving a well all of them truly master of their craft one might think this dining room would only appeal to older diner but i saw a diverse mix of young diner in their twenty to older folk all of whom looked like they were truly enjoying their experience the service here made all of u feel special and well cared for there are so many review about how excellent the food is and they are correct every morsel of food wa treated masterfully and nothing wa an after thought the pasta the protein the cheese the pastry all amazing and review: we have been to one market many time for happy hour after work but never for dinner they are located across the ferry building on the corner which is a beautiful location the restaurant is very large and ha a beautiful setting whether it be a chef table dining room or a private dining room we recently dined there for a birthday celebration and had a wonderful experience with the encouragement of our server we started with the special cucumber salad which wa delicious we then had pork entre perfectly cooked and delicious smoked prime rib not sure if i like my prime rib smoked a the smoke overpowers the taste of the meat it is served with spinach mashed potato and yorkshire pudding all of these were amazingly delicious even with the smoked prime rib orchiette pasta simple yet very delicious since it wa my birthday celebration they sent a large celebration dessert at no charge to the table and we just devoured it if you are looking to celebrate a special occasion or just have a wonderful pampered meal with great food give this place a try we love sitting at a chef s table to watch the preparation of the meal will request that next time more

review: located in the italian neighborhood of north beach park tavern is the sister restaurant to marlowe which i had previously visited and enjoyed immensely so i had high hope i wa certainly not let down our table wa not ready for our reservation time so we started with classy cocktail at the bar and no sooner did we take a first sip and our table wa ready so we move into the dining room excellent handling and speedy service in a unexpected situation our table wa right next to the bay of window at the front of the restaurant we enjoyed the lingering sun and cool breeze from outside while working our way through the amazing menu first tasty treat like wagyu beef jerky and brussels sprout chip a house specialty and all too delicious i had tried them at marlowe and fell in love tasting every component of every course like we are judging some classy food contest we continue with a take on fried green tomato and a kobe beef tartare served with a deconstructed ceasar salad i wa particularly impressed with a garnish of pickled caper berry leaf the ingredient and re imagining of dish here is exemplary the main are no le impressive my pan seared salmon with it dusting of fleur de sel is probably the best salmon i have ever eaten and dessert oh my the dark chocolate torte is divine the crme brule lusciously creamy and the light a air chocolate chiffon birthday cake come complete with a lit birthday candle don t miss out on a chance to try park tavern it is the best high class restaurant around without all of the pomp and pageantry it just feel comfortable more

review: great service and no attitude for not ordering alcoholic beverage the brunch menu is decent and there seems to be something for everyone it wa my first avocado toast experience and it wa a perfect starter not too filling and very tasty the avocado wa fresh and ripe and it wa sliced neatly across the top of fresh just fluffy enough focaccia delicious i m converted and will be looking for the dish everywhere i ordered shrimp and grit for my main brunch dish and loved every bite the shrimp were big and plump fresh and prepared without the head thankfully the grit portion wa a well prepared polenta not too gritty or dry or mushy the dish wa nicely arranged and there wa a spicy red sauce that added just the right amount of heat park tavern offer sidewalk seating but i opted to dine indoors the room is large and airy with dark wood accent and just enough space to move around freely without bumping into other diner acoustic were just fine not too noisy but definitely lively i ll go back to park tavern next time i visit sf and try dinner more

review: i live on the other end of town and always like to venture into other neighborhood to discover new place to dine i had read some information that this place wa named best new restaurant on and that it wa part of the big night restaurant group for those in the know that includes other location such a marlowe and the cavalier one of my favorite pre theater location i visited with a friend and we arrived early to grab a drink at the bar it wa a relatively busy friday night but not too crowded we grabbed some stool and i ordered a mcclaren gin cocktail and my friend went with a glass of malbec later we checked in with the front desk and were seated at a two top in the front section of the restaurant it wa a little noisy for some reason elvis wa playing over the speaker our table wa super wobbly and our server fixed it perfectly within minute for food we each order a deviled egg so good with bacon and a bit of a pepper kick then we shared the warm goat cheese salad which wa perfect for a main course i went with the short rib and my friend ordered the steak frites both were spot on we finished by sharing the ice cream sandwich vanilla ice cream with blueberry this wa an off point because it wa delivered to our table but we had no utensil and the blueberry were meant to be dolloped on top so we had to grab a passing person who brought back two fork it would have been helpful to have some knife a well in order to neatly scoop the scattered berry we also enjoyed a few glass of mablec during the meal should ve gone for the bottle all in all a good experience i d definitely recommend this place it s a bit pricey but the food wa delicious more

which beer to try we settled on a couple of the pink and the green a nice lighter ipa with watermelon cucumber and hibiscus a neat trio of taste that is refreshing and at alcohol rather moderate i tried the invasion of the barley snatcher barrel aged barley wine a mouthful indeed and at alcohol and ibus it is quite a mouthful of taste a well very dark and bitter like i like it and a perfect small glass good considering the kick it can have for you moving on to food we ordered a couple of the sully s cheese curd a couple of the wilson s wicked wing an order of the totchos and a brewmaster s fish and chip the food came rather quickly and wa just a we remembered the cheese curd are very good here among the best i have found anywhere with just a little grease left on the plate not too much but enough to notice still very good taste especially with the chipotle ranch dip marinara not my favorite with the cheese curd the wing were drenched in sauce and literally finger licking good you ll need both moist towelettes that are provided the totchos were a hit a well always a favorite with the bacon on the side they are tater tot topped with red onion tomato cheddar cheese pepper jack cheese pico de gallo salsa fresh cilantro and cilantro sour cream oh so good and the fish and chip were delicious too with the fish lightly battered and not too greasy very nice with tartar sauce or vinegar the fry were hot and crispy a well the meal wa delightful and the service wa excellent with water and iced tea kept topped off and dish cleared quickly thanks aili if you re in the area and review: growing up a meat eater in texas doesn t prepare one for atelier crenn but creen doe make you happy you escaped the state for a healthier life in california from the very beginning of this experience the existential philosophy of ethical hedonism sustainability is stamped upon your forehead while the food is definitely fine art it is also belly friendly and the portion size are most definitely perfectly sized for long evening some other fine dining location should take note at the close of the meal is the dessert course which are nothing short of pure genius we were laughing at the table over the audacity of the creative team in the kitchen our only critique of the evening would be the disappointment in the wine pairing especially a most of them had a heavy carbon footprint and were out of step with the local sustainability so well executed on the menu while there were some of the top napa and sonoma name on the greater wine list there wa a decidedly lack of incorporation of these great local wine into the sustainable presentation an organic producer from europe just doesn t meet the sustainability ethos when i return we will pay corkage or order some great local wine the abalone wa ridiculous and made me remember the day i met george moscone and had abalone at the waterfront just a great day to remember finally and most importantly the wait staff wa impeccable but remember to bring your wallet a this joint isn t cheap more

review: id been wanting to visit salitos for a long time my husband my mother in law and i went last night it wa a saturday and very busy the atmosphere wa celebratory and the location is obviously wonderful to enjoy a meal i wouldnt say the waiter wa overlying friendly but it wa a busy evening so im sure he had his work cut out in any case i ordered the sea bass my mil the salmon and my husband the crab cake the bass wa nicely cooked and though it lacked seasoning they provide salt and pepper on the table i enjoyed it but the cous cous it come with is lack luster at best and mixed in with sad frozen vegetable the salmon same story nice fish but lazily served with the same uninspiring cous cous the crab cake were tasty and crispy they come a is with no garnish and nothing green even we had to ask for lemon so i will say that the fish itself is nicely done not spectacular but good however what this place lack is some freshness going to a seafood restaurant i would expect some fresh herb and zingy flavour and the food definitely lack this hence only the three star if you want a decent place in a nice location for sure it not a bad one but it not cheap and dont expect to be blown away by the food we all agreed that we wont be rushing back any time soon more

review: last thursday june the taco shop had a soft re opening not only did it not disappoint it lived up to the past high standard of excellence and went beyond compliance with the strict protocol restaurant must follow during their closure they went to work on deep cleaning and sprucing up the already well appointed and maintained space new paint dcor and freshly stained deck were just some of the improvement you feel cleanliness and safety immediately the entrance ha a colorful rope closure so guest will stop to have a quick forehead temp check and then get a squirt of hand sanitizer more than half of their table have been removed to comply with the required distancing whats been added is the north parking area ha been converted into a charming outdoor dining space with whimsical beach dcor colorful tiled table with umbrella are back a new sided bamboo fence super large tin planter to border off the area that are plump full of succulent wooden boat and alongside each one is a fun metal bird sculpture all thats missing is the sand youll still think youre on a lovely beach in baja of course all the table are at the proper distance and the warmth of the afternoon sun is combined with the soft gentle bay breeze to create a marvelous environment their menu ha been scaled down a bit but the food is still absolutely delicious everything is always made from scratch fresh from the kitchen and served up in colorful dishware you cannot go wrong with any item on the menu margarita are still refreshing and tasty back too is their loyal and hardworking staff of skilled and friendly server working at the top of their form theyve always lived up to fastidious cleaning now even more so every surface touched is thoroughly cleaned and sanitized after every guest ready for the next customer this eatery ha been a successful favorite for local and out of area visitor for almost year treat yourself soon and enjoy a scrumptious meal with your friend and family more

review: we had a relative in town for the night and choose crustacean for it unique offering of dungeon crab cooked in very interesting way our party had both the roasted and the drunken crab the roasted is cooked with butter and is very delicious in that buttery kind of way the drunken is steamed in wine so there is not alcohol to the finished dish it is lighter than the roasted version both use black pepper to give the dish a little bit of heat the service wa excellent and very attentive always removing the dish that had accumulated shell this is a place to take your time to eat your dinner don t go here for a quick meal not because of the service they are very good about you taking you time but for the time it take to eat a whole crab the menu also includes a large variety of other seafood dish we noticed a couple of large group eating here so it look like a good place for a group more

review: one of san francisco s best kept secret is the rotunda in neiman marcus in the heart of union square the rotunda is perhaps san francisco s finest setting for lunch or afternoon tea a beautiful setting on the floor of neiman marcus dining under a stained glass dome with beautiful view of union square a if the beautiful atmosphere wasn t enough patron are also served some of the freshest and tastiest food in the city unfortunately the rotunda is not open for dinner but breakfast or dinner here will carry one through the day the meal always start with a complimentary small cup of consomme which is bewildering but quite pleasant a favorite is the fish sandwich which is quite hearty and tasty breaded and fried but not enough to overwhelm the taste of the fish the truffle fry are also very fragrant and tasteful an excellent restaurant that should always be on one s list when visiting more

review: we ate here the night before one of our party wa running the sf marathon for carb loading it is a classic italian i would say the decor is fairly old fashioned and the dining room is on the small side we made a reservation which is probably a good idea given the compact nature of the restaurant and were greeted efficiently but in a somewhat unsmiling manner that is atypical of italian restaurant in my experience however nothing to complain about although this fairly taciturn service wa repeated throughout the meal this is not your boisterous noisy italian restaurant at least it wasn t when we visited although admittedly it wa very early when we sat down to dinner it is reserved and easy to hold conversation across the table the food is first class well presented flavorsome and overall very well done many of the classic are represented here including many option for pasta of course and all of the dish we ordered were excellent including the calamari we ordered for the table which is something of an appetizer staple at least for u sf is rightly infamous a one if not the most expensive city in the u so easting downtown is never going to be cheap but overall the value is there when the quality is good and here it most certainly is definitely worth seeking out it sits on a street corner not far from union square more
